1.text: Job also added to this, using figures of speech, and he said:

2.text: As God lives, who has taken away my judgment, and the Almighty, who has led my soul to bitterness,

3.text: as long as my breath remains in me and the breath of God remains in my nostrils,

4.text: my lips will not speak iniquity, nor will my tongue devise lies.

5.text: Far be it from me that I should judge you to be right, for, until I expire, I will not withdraw from my innocence.

6.text: I will not forsake my justification, which I have just begun to grasp, for my heart does not find blame for me in my whole life.

7.text: Let the impious be as my enemy, and the sinful, as my adversary.

8.text: For what hope is there for the hypocrite, if he greedily plunders and God does not free his soul?

9.text: Will God pay attention to his cry, when anguish overcomes him?

10.text: Or will he take delight in the Almighty and call upon God at all times?

11.text: I will teach you through the hand of God, what the Almighty holds, and I will not conceal it.

12.text: Behold, you know all this, and so why do you speak vain things without a reason?

13.text: This is the portion of the impious man with God, and the inheritance of the violent, which they will receive from the Almighty.

14.text: If his sons should happen to increase, they will be for the sword, and his grandsons will not be satisfied with bread.

15.text: Whatever will remain of him will be buried in the ruins, and his widows will not weep.

16.text: If he will amass silver as if it were dirt and fabricate garments as if they were clay,

17.text: then yes, he will gather, but the just will be clothed with it and the innocent will divide the silver.

18.text: He has built his house like a moth, and he has made a makeshift shelter like a sentry.

19.text: When he falls asleep, the rich man will leave him with nothing; he will open his eyes and find nothing.

20.text: Destitution will surround him like water; a storm will overwhelm him in the night.

21.text: A burning wind will pick him up and carry him away, and, like a whirlwind, it will rush him from his place.

22.text: And it will hurl over him and will not spare him; fleeing from its power, he will go into exile.

23.text: He will clasp his hands over himself, and he will hiss at himself, while considering his situation.
